I would give this response a score of 85.

The respondent correctly identifies the New Testament understanding of the church as being more than just a physical structure, emphasizing the gathering of believers united in faith and practice. They also mention the church's mission to spread Jesus' teachings and serve the wider community, which aligns with the concern of understanding the church's role beyond mere building.

However, I would deduct points because the response doesn't fully capture the depth and breadth of the New Testament's portrayal of the church as the Body of Christ. The respondent's statement about "a local assembly of believers meeting together" is somewhat vague and doesn't convey the full richness of the concept. Additionally, while they do mention the church's mission, they don't explicitly connect this to the idea of the church being the Body of Christ, which is a key theme in the New Testament.

Overall, this response demonstrates a good understanding of the New Testament's emphasis on the church as a community of believers, but could benefit from further development and nuance.
